page.title: 03Local History
page.content: {LOCAL}HISTORY;Original siting,TownEnd, situated at the Northern edge of village and appeared in the 1086 Domesday Book.{Earliest Settlement;} not clear,possibly stone-age.In 410AD. it was known as the Farmstead of Kroyenga.Anglo-Saxon farmland boundaries are still in evidence.More recently the village was ravaged by the Plague in 1609/10 and was sealed off.{The Smithy;}skills acquired as ancient armourers,made and repaired farm implements.Cattle and geese'feet were tarred en route from Ireland via Liverpool to Birmingham.Pack animals and horses were reshod.{Cottage {Industry;}the watch making industry gravitated from Prescot to Cronton and became famous for its tool making.Old Cronton family names suggest these skills could have a Belgium or Dutch origin.
